thread.title: Royals Narrowly Lose to North Florida Despite Strong Second Half
thread.title_full: Royals Narrowly Lose to North Florida Despite Strong Second Half

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Royals Narrowly Lose to North Florida Despite Strong Second Half
text:
Royals Narrowly Lose to North Florida Despite Strong Second Half
Queens University of Charlotte fell 2-1 to North Florida in a closely contested match. After conceding a goal in the first half, the Royals rallied to equalize in the second half but were thwarted by a late goal from North Florida. This loss marks the Royals' ninth match decided by one goal this season.
- Hannah Dike-Lawlor made six saves on 18 shots faced.
- Queens registered just two shots on target throughout the match.
- The Royals currently hold a record of 3-10-4, with a conference record of 2-6-1 in ASUN.
- This match is Queens' fifth one-goal loss at home this season, highlighting their struggles in close games.
Queens will conclude the regular season on Saturday, October 25, against Jacksonville at home, aiming to improve their ASUN standing with a strong performance.
Bottom LineThe Royals need to translate their defensive resilience and offensive opportunity into scoring as they approach the end of the season, especially in tight matchups where every goal counts.
Read more at Queens University of Charlotte Athletics
